greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = sigma(6*n+5)/6.
comment: Expansion of q^(-5/6) * (eta(q)^-1 * eta(q^2) * eta(q^3) * eta(q^6))^2 in powers of q. - _Michael Somos_, Sep 16 2004
2*a(n) is the number of bipartitions of 2*n+1 that are 3-cores. See Baruah and Nath. - _Michel Marcus_, Apr 13 2020
link: Ivan Neretin, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Nayandeep Deka Baruah and Kallol Nath, Infinite families of arithmetic identities and congruences for bipartitions with 3-cores, Journal of Number Theory, Volume 149, April 2015, Pages 92-104.
formula: G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (36 t)) = (t/i)^2 g(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t) and g() is the g.f. for A252650. -
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( (eta(x^2 + A) * eta(x^3 + A) * eta(x^6 + A) / eta(x + A))^2, n))} /* _Michael Somos_, Sep 16 2004 */
results.author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, Sep 14 2004
